title: Should I still join the military even if my boyfriend doesn’t want me to? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, he doesn’t have control over you. If he makes an ultimatum follow what you’ve wanted to for a long time. It’s either him or the service, which one you choose is none of our concern, only you can choose. Story time: I had an online relationship about two years back with a little, she was an adult at the time. Thankfully it didn’t last long as our maturity levels were so different, but I will say she was a wonderful person. She had mentioned how she had gone to a recruiter, stating she wanted to follow in her father’s footsteps of becoming a Marine. And here’s the thing, I was fine with it. I had no control over her, after all we were an online relationship. I discussed with her why she wanted to, if she understood what it would take, and that she should never give up. I also told her that I worried about her in the future, and if she’s deployed to always be careful. Most of what our conversations were about were to help me understand certain things, and make sure she really KNEW she wanted this. Our relationship ended maybe a month before she went to boot camp, we had stayed friends and for the summer I was excited to hear whether or not she became a Marine or not. It was maybe August when she got back to me with a photo of her in uniform standing at attention, smiling the great big smiles you see from every new Marine on Quora. I’ll see if I can find the photo, and her account. For most guys it’s the fear of the unknown. Will she be deployed?? Is she going to face harassment by her male colleagues?? If my current little decides the military is the way to go I will be more mature about it, show less of my feelings, and make sure she knows what she wants to do upon graduating. I will worry for those weeks, but once she comes out a new person I’ll be the happiest man in the world, and maybe, just maybe she can smack some sense into me, and help me out when I need it.

I suspect your boyfriend has very good reasons for not wanting you to go. You are going to become much less dependant on him. Katy Perry even did a video of it. You are going to meet a bunch of driven, fit, loyal, dedicated young men. At about a 10:1 ratio.Weighted against these guys, your boyfriend isn’t going to make 2nd place. I’ve been in over 40 years. In that time I can only think of a dozen ladies who didn’t end up with an army boyfriend, at least for some of the time. Lastly you will be entering a world where he won’t be 1st place. You won’t be able to take the morning off work to take his dog to the vet, If your unit has to work late, he’ll have to learn to make dinner.You will be too busy doing your own laundry to do his. But let’s say he is that guy who is better than all the guys you’ll be working with, good on you, you have a keeper. The ladies who have boyfriends/husbands outside the military, have exceptional men, who love the heck out of their wives. I say, join and let the chips fall where they may.

No offense to your boyfriend (really) but that is not his decision to make. I may be mistaken but, it seems to me, that this is your life we're talking about here; only you have the authority to make that choice (unless you're a minor. Even then, you need your parent's permission, and not your boyfriend's.) Look at it this way: your BF may or may not be with you for the rest of your life; but your decision to join or not join the military will change the course of your life. You are wise to seek advice but the final say-so belongs to you and only you.

It comes down to who’s making the long term decisions in your life. If it’s you, then go ahead. If you’ve let him take over control of you life then do what he tells you to do. So of course you should make the decision that you feel is the best for your future. That said, consider why your boyfriend doesn’t want you to. If his objections are centered on your best interests rather than his, then take them into consideration.

My boyfriend is in the national guard himself. He really regrets his decision. He is redoing boot camp for the second time because he failed his PT test . He is really upset about that . I have mentioned joining and he really doesn’t want me too . I kinda want too tho . I really love my boyfriend and I want our relationship to last . What should I do?

It’s your decision. I’d say do it and let him learn to work around it. Or drop him if he can’t and starts complaining and whining. You deserve better in that case Now it could be worse. I want to join the Air National Guard, but my mom is terrified of the military. I gave up Army NG for Air in hopes that she’s be more willing to not worry. That and the Air Force resonates with my aviation side. Army was really tempting for my love of getting physical and getting fought though… Good luck!

If you want to, then yes. My ex was in the Air Force when we met. He retired 7 years later. It was a good life for us. But the main reason why I say to join the military if you want is because I wanted to when I finished high school, but my daddy did not want me to, then is something I have regretted for over 60 years.

It us likely that nothing you read on Quora will actually influence your decision which is good because the decision should be yours and yours alone. Young people need to be selfish and do what is right for themselves. Having to worry about someone else makes figuring out what is truly right for you far more challenging. Good luck !!

I would think it depends on how serious your relationship is. You should take his feelings into account. The only person who really knows if you should go or not is you though. You're the one in charge of your future.

Yes! Do it! There are other single men out there! If you don’t you will spend the rest of your life wishing that you did! I only wish that I could have spent some time in the military. The benefits you receive today are outstanding!

You should consider your boyfriend of course, but ultimately you are your very own master though. It is your life and your decision. I joined the military above my parents request and had an awesome time. That doesn’t mean it’ll be the same for everyone though. Ultimately though it’s your life, your decision. Don’t ever let anyone decide your life for you. Be independent.

Only if you had a strong desire to enter the military before. You’re not doing it for him, you’re doing it for you. If you can’t bear the thought of him being out of your life permanently, don’t join. Are you sure he doesn’t have more girlfriends than just you?
